items.q: What is the basic unit of life?
items.explanation: All living organisms are composed of one or more cells.

items.q: Viruses can reproduce on their own.
items.explanation: Viruses must infect a host cell to hijack its machinery to replicate.

items.q: Veins carry oxygen-rich blood away from the heart.
items.explanation: Arteries generally carry oxygen-rich blood away from the heart; veins return oxygen-poor blood.

items.q: What term describes animals that regulate their own body temperature internally?
What organ is primarily responsible for filtering alcohol and toxins from the blood?
items.explanation: The liver is vital for detoxification and metabolism.

items.q: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
items.explanation: They produce most of the cell's supply of adenosine triphosphate (ATP).

items.q: What kind of symbiotic relationship benefits both species involved?
items.explanation: An example is bees and flowers.

items.q: In a food web, what level do plants occupy?
items.explanation: They produce their own energy through photosynthesis.
It holds the instructions for the development and function of living things.

items.q: Which human blood type is considered the universal donor (specifically for red blood cells)?
items.explanation: It lacks the A and B antigens and the Rh factor.
